docs.abstract: In his debut, our new media columnist says The Times has become like Facebook or Google — a digital behemoth crowding out the competition.
docs.snippet: In his debut, our new media columnist says The Times has become like Facebook or Google — a digital behemoth crowding out the competition.
docs.lead_paragraph: The first time I met A.G. Sulzberger, the publisher of The New York Times, I tried to hire him.

headline.main: Why the Success of The New York Times May Be Bad News for Journalism
headline.print_headline: Why the Success of The Times May Be Bad News for Journalism

docs.abstract: The monthly employment report left unanswered questions about the potential economic impact of the outbreak.
docs.snippet: The monthly employment report left unanswered questions about the potential economic impact of the outbreak.
docs.lead_paragraph: For the second month in a row, the economy churned out a blockbuster number of jobs, the government reported Friday, an impressive performance in an era of slow-and-steady employment growth.

headline.main: U.S. Added 273,000 Jobs in February Before Coronavirus Spread Widely
headline.print_headline: U.S. Added 273,000 Jobs in February Before Virus Spread Widely

docs.abstract: The agency proposed the penalty over the installation of unapproved equipment in the 737 Max and other aircraft.
docs.snippet: The agency proposed the penalty over the installation of unapproved equipment in the 737 Max and other aircraft.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Aviation Administration recommended on Friday that Boeing be fined nearly $20 million for installing equipment in the 737 Max and other aircraft before its approval.

headline.main: Boeing Faces $20 Million Fine by F.A.A.
headline.print_headline: F.A.A. Suggests Boeing Face Fine of $20 Million

byline.original: By Niraj Chokshi and David Gelles

docs.abstract: Ms. Maxwell, who was once Mr. Epstein’s girlfriend, said he had promised to pay her legal fees for claims brought against her by his accusers.
docs.snippet: Ms. Maxwell, who was once Mr. Epstein’s girlfriend, said he had promised to pay her legal fees for claims brought against her by his accusers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The whereabouts of Ghislaine Maxwell, the former girlfriend and longtime business associate of Jeffrey Epstein, has been largely a mystery since the registered sex offender was arrested last summer on sex trafficking charges.

headline.main: Jeffrey Epstein’s Ex, Ghislaine Maxwell, Sues His Estate for Legal Fees
headline.print_headline: Epstein’s Former Girlfriend Sues His Estate for Legal Fees

docs.abstract: Americans have been alarmed by empty grocery shelves, but while food suppliers and retailers say they are struggling with surging demand, they insist the supply chain remains strong.
docs.snippet: Americans have been alarmed by empty grocery shelves, but while food suppliers and retailers say they are struggling with surging demand, they insist the supply chain remains strong.
docs.lead_paragraph: The aisles and aisles of empty store shelves give the appearance that the United States, improbably and alarmingly, is running out of food.

headline.main: ‘There Is Plenty of Food in the Country’
headline.print_headline: Producers Assure Nervous Shoppers: ‘There Is Plenty of Food’

byline.original: By Michael Corkery, David Yaffe-Bellany, Amelia Nierenberg and Quoctrung Bui

docs.abstract: A new surge of bond purchases is intended to counteract “serious risks” to the eurozone economy as investors start to doubt Italy’s creditworthiness.
docs.snippet: A new surge of bond purchases is intended to counteract “serious risks” to the eurozone economy as investors start to doubt Italy’s creditworthiness.
docs.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — The European Central Bank will begin an enormous new wave of bond purchases meant to counteract the “serious risks” to the eurozone caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

headline.main: Europe’s Central Bank Vastly Expands Stimulus Measures
headline.print_headline: Declaring ‘No Limits,’ European Central Bank Expands Stimulus

docs.abstract: The Social Security Administration has more than 1,200 offices that serve thousands of beneficiaries every day.
docs.snippet: The Social Security Administration has more than 1,200 offices that serve thousands of beneficiaries every day.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Social Security Administration operates a vast network of more than 1,200 offices around the country that help thousands of Americans every day with applications for retirement, disability and Medicare benefits.

headline.main: Coronavirus Is Closing Social Security Offices. Here’s How to Get Benefit Help.

docs.abstract: The grounding of the 737 Max after two deadly crashes had already strained the company. The coronavirus is pushing it to the brink.
docs.snippet: The grounding of the 737 Max after two deadly crashes had already strained the company. The coronavirus is pushing it to the brink.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the crisis caused by the coronavirus continues to spiral out of control, the vast ramifications of the global economy’s screeching to a halt are already on display at one of most important companies in the United States: Boeing.

headline.main: Boeing Mirrors the Economy. It Doesn’t Look Good.

docs.abstract: Hopes for an enormous stimulus package from Washington could not overcome worries about the world economy.
docs.snippet: Hopes for an enormous stimulus package from Washington could not overcome worries about the world economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: This briefing is no longer updating. Read the latest developments in the coronavirus outbreak here.

headline.main: Fed Announces More Loans as Investor Alarm Persists

docs.abstract: Bailouts of companies or industries just cause division. The answer: a government “bridge loan” to everyone.
docs.snippet: Bailouts of companies or industries just cause division. The answer: a government “bridge loan” to everyone.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Covid-19 crisis will take time to be solved by science. The economic crisis can be solved right now.

headline.main: This Is the Only Way to End the Coronavirus Financial Panic
headline.print_headline: How to Hold A Job Open For Everyone
